results.title: Developing objectives
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow, Kaiser Aluminium and Chemical Corporation and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
An industrial training film which uses animation to show employees methods of writing and developing work objectives which are understandable, measurable, challenging, achievable, and with a target dagte for completion.

results.title: Developing leadership
results.brief_description: Discusses those traits of character which contribute to a boy’s capacity as a leader. The film is centred around a story in which a boy responds to an emergency and proves himself to be a leader by his enthusiasm, by his vision and imagination, and by his readiness to accept responsibility.

results.title: Developing countries (NP)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Global Economy”.
The effectiveness of foreign aid to developing countries has become a central concern for economists moving towards the 21st Century. This episode of the Open Learning Economics course debates the long-term goals of foreign aid and argues that a more effective means of ensuring financial development is to encourage developing countries to enter the international market. The first part of the episode examines the history of South Korea, which after the Korean War began to emerge as one of the most powerful economies in the Asian region. The experience of the South Koreans is contrasted with Sri Lanka which, in the 1950s, was the favored south-east Asian country by Western powers in terms of aid grants and economic assistance. However, due to Government inefficiency and the dependance on import substitution, it remains one of Asia’s poorest economies. The last part examines the history of Tanzania, which emerged as a nation in 1964. The large amount of aid granted to this very poor country has not translated into economic success. Using these cases studies, a panel of economists debate alternatives to aid for developing nations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia

results.title: Devastation
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and National Films Council of the Motion Picture Industry
results.brief_description: A plea for the planting of trees throughout Australia to offset damage by bush fires and thoughtless timber cutters. Shows how tree destruction results in soil erosion, floods and water shortage but also how government planting of trees and voluntary planting by community groups can alleviate the problem.

results.title: Deutsch Direkt! [text]
results.brief_description: The book enables you to get the most out of the language course offered in the videos. It contains the texts of conversations and interviews recorded and filmed for the programs in West Germany and Austria together with language notes, exercises, background information, reading passages and progress checks. It also includes a handy reference section.

results.title: Deutsch Direkt! [kit]
results.brief_description: The kit contains three audio-cassettes, a workbook and guide for teachers which can all be used in conjunction with the videorecorded course in simple German. The cassettes include some of the conversations from the video programs, with some pronunciation exercises. The books include language notes, exercises, background information, reading passages and progress checks as well as a handy reference section. Contents: 3 audio-cassettes, 2 books.

results.title: Determination of molecular geometry: spectroscopic methods (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Concerned with the use of absorbtion spectra data in the calculation of structural information such as bond lengths, bond angles and bond strengths. The emphasis in the program is on the electrical characteristics of molecules which absorb electro-magnetic radiation, and how absorbtion in the microwave and infra-red regions of the spectra can be related to motions of the individual molecules.

constellations_other.name: Neo-noir
constellations_other.description: Blade Runner's retro-futurist setting lends it a timeless quality, while also connecting it to the past and the future.

results.title: Destinos: an introduction to Spanish. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: A series of introductory Spanish language programs with each program structured carefully so that three kinds of Spanish are used: conversational Spanish spoken by the characters in the drama, the narrator’s Spanish and the Spanish spoken by the instructor, Raquel, who breaks in periodically during the episode to explain and reinforce particular language structures and grammar. We also learn about the Spanish speaking world, its culture, life and customs.

results.title: Destinos: an introduction to Spanish
results.brief_description: A series of introductory Spanish language programmes, in the form of a long-running mystery drama about Don Fernando and the secrets of his past. Learn Spanish while the mystery takes you all over the Spanish speaking world. Each programme is structured carefully so that three kinds of Spanish are used. Conversational Spanish, which is spoken by the characters in the drama. The narrator’s Spanish, and the Spanish spoken by the instructor, Raquel, who breaks in periodically during the episode to explain and re-inforce particular language structures and grammar. In this series, you will learn about the Spanish speaking world, its culture, life and customs.
